column5: Thats the one thank you.. g73
Looking on picking one up any ideas on where to find them.... thanks
I have no idea what a judge board is.
It is the measuring board that us tournament guys from up north use...
Thank you for being man enough to admit it, Camp Chef. I, too, had no idea what one was.- Steve

I bought a Golden Rule Tournament board - 22" - a long time ago. One will last you forever. I just wanted one that was long enough for the 18" walleyes.. I think it's better and more convenient than tapes. Just set his jaw on the bent end, stretch the tail, and you're done. Found this link w picture on google..http://lltackle.com/Home/tabid/61/Pr..._Board___.aspx

Dang, they get big $$ for some of those pieces of plastic. My option: went to the local friendly True Value hardware store several years ago and got an aluminum 36" yardstick. Took a piece of 1" aluminum strap from a garage shelf and cut a 6" piece, bent a 90 degree angle in the middle, and used a small stainless bolt to attach it to the hole already drilled in one end of the measuring stick. Total cost: less than $4. Works fine, doesn't rust, won't stretch in the rain nor shrink when it dries out!
If you mean the judge ruler Thorne Brothers has them online.
